alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 7:15PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Ojo Caliente Below La Madera affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Rio Ojo Caliente below La Madera. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Bankfull Stage. Minor inundation due to overbank flow possible. Nuisance flooding is possible in low lying areas downstream near the confluence of the Rio Ojo Caliente and the Rio Chama. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 6.8 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Rio Ojo Caliente La Madera 7.0 5.8 Tue 6 pm MDT 5.9 6.1 6.1 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
